intro: Micranthes tischii, commonly known as the Tisch's micranthus, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils in woodland areas, showcasing its adaptability to specific ecological niches. Its small, showy flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
